p: Camphor is a volatile, terpenoid ketone. It can either be obtained from the wood of the camphor tree ( Cinnamomum camphora) or it can be chemically synthesized from turpentine [ 105]. Camphor was found to activate and desensitize TRPV1 channels [ 106]. Notably, it is reported that camphor exhibits a bimodal concentration-dependent effect on TRPA1 channels: at high concentrations it blocked the channel [ 106, 107], while at low concentrations it activated the receptor [ 107].
